SENT.plain: The van der Woude syndrome was studied in a seven-generation kindred
Lip pits were the most common manifestation of affected persons
They occurred in 88% of the affected and were the only manifestations in 64%; clefts of lip and palate occurred in 21%
Careful examination showed minor manifestations of the syndrome in several individuals who had considered themselves unaffected
The distribution of manifestations and the risk to off-spring differed appreciably from that reported in the literature
The implications of these findings for genetic counseling are discussed
